New Records: The Oklahoma City Thunder extended their season-opening win streak to 7-0, setting a new record for the best start in franchise history.
The Thunder's defensive performance forced the Orlando Magic to shoot 35.4% overall and 14.7% from beyond the arc, setting new defensive milestones.
Key Match Events: The Thunder dominated the first quarter with 39 points, their highest scoring quarter of the season.
Jalen Williams scored 14 points in the first quarter, with all six makes coming from different spots on the floor, giving the Thunder a quick 5-0 lead.
Orlando's 8-0 run in the second quarter brought the game within 10 points, but their poor shooting from the perimeter hindered their comeback efforts.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander made two consecutive banked-in jumpers to extend the Thunder's lead to 17 points.
Isaiah Joe made three straight triples from the 2:19 to 1:15 stretch to extend the Thunder's lead to 24 points.
Pre-Game Insights: The Magic started their fourth different lineup of the year due to injuries to Paolo Banchero and Wendell Carter Jr.
Cason Wallace made his third start of the season, joining Gilgeous-Alexander, Holmgren, Williams, and Luguentz Dort in the lineup.
Post-Match Reflections: Thunder coach expressed pride in the team's defensive effort and overall performance.
The win was seen as a crucial step toward the championship for the Thunder.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chet Holmgren recorded 14 points, nine rebounds, and two blocks before leaving the game early due to injury.
The game's total score of 102-86 was a new season low for the Thunder in terms of points allowed.
Others: The Thunder will play their second road matchup against the Nuggets on Nov. 6 at 8 p.m. CST, with a 1-0 season series lead.
